meanings.sent1: The patient had an amnestic episode after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The amnestic man couldn't remember where he parked his car.
meanings.sent3: The amnestic professor forgot to bring his notes to the lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an amnestic fog, shrouded in forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The amnestic effect of the medication made her memories vanish like smoke.

meanings.definition: Causing or characterized by memory loss.
meanings.sent1: The amnestic drug had unexpected side effects on the patient.
meanings.sent2: The elderly woman's condition was amnestic in nature.
meanings.sent3: The amnestic computer program kept deleting important files.
meanings.sent4: The passage of time had an amnestic quality, erasing memories like sand in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious potion had an amnestic power, wiping away all recollection of the past.
